data.title: My final resting place
data.text: I read about this place recently and decided to give it a try on a Wednesday night during the world series. The place was easy to find and we were able to walk in and sit at the bar. However, it was busy so I would not expect to sit down at the bar on any other night. The beer list is great, and the menu is quite interesting. I ordered the cesear salad and the burger. The salad was great the dressing has to be one of the favorites. The burger came with mayo, which I asked for it to be excluded but it still was great. Cooked correctly and the beer cheese sauce made it very tasty. Check out this place...you would not be disappointed.

data.title: Excellent addition to what's become 'restaurant row' on Main Street, Alpharetta
data.text: Went there for dinner on a Friday.  A bit of a wait, but you can stand around outside (in nice weather) because getting to the bar to wait is pretty difficult.  Its 'sister' restaurant next door (South Main) wasn't as busy surprisingly but it was nice out, so we waited for an outdoor table.  The cauliflower app with Korean BBQ sauce was soooo good with a nice cold martini.  We had apps and small plates rather than a larger entre.  All very, very good.  Service excellent.  Interesting placement of serviceware - in a box on the table.  Very clever and efficient.  All in all, even with the crowds, I'd go back.  Note to others- the inside tables are really close to each other.  Not too crazy about that set-up.

data.title: Just there for drinks
data.text:
Went two evenings back to back the weekend of the Wire & Wood Songwriters Festival.
Only there for drinks. Great selection of craft beers at pretty standard prices ($6-8). Mixed drinks seem over priced. Our server said their speciality Old Fashioned was the same price as a well Old Fashioned. There is no way that was right. If so $10 is way too much for an Old Fashioned w/well bourbon. Had the specialty Old Fashioned and it was good but not great or special. Ancho Mama's Rita ($10) had a bite & was good.
Decent wine pour. 
Crowded and fun atmosphere. Popcorn was tasty & great to have to munch on.

data.title: I liked it!
data.text: My husband and I had a date night, and decided to head to Alph to try this new venue. We parked in the public parking behind the restaurant, and got seated right away. The atmosphere had that industrial feel which I love. I think this venue has been described as a "sports bar" but it's much better than that. Our service was great, and apps and dinner were really good. I enjoyed the cauliflower and French dip(FFI) and my husband enjoyed the wings and chicken sandwich. We went on a Sat night so it was crowded and loud, but we had a great time. I would definitely go back.

data.title: Very Good 1st Visit
data.text:
This is a new restaurant with some outdoor seating on Main Street and plenty of TV's for sports. 

Varied menu; good beer selection. 

I had the shrimp sandwich (NOPSI) which I will definitely go back for.  Shrimp was battered and crunchy and the avocado and tomato complimented the shrimp.  Mac and cheese side is best described as mac and cheese "lite" which I was happy with given my diet as it was not overdone with too much cheese. 

My wife had s chicken Asian bowl which she enjoyed. 

We will be back!

data.title: Great New Place
data.text: We will definitely be back. Fantastic draft beer list coupled with complimentary popcorn to start your meal off right. If you are looking for a good appetizer choice, try the pigs in the blanket. The smokey flavor and dipping sauce is amazing. I had the burger which was not disappointing at all and good fries. Lastly, you must get the homemade ice cream sandwich

data.title: Great tasty lunch. . . .
data.text: Stopped by for lunch - not disappointed - great casual atmosphere . . . . our server, Ryan (Pippin) had very helpful suggestions - each was a winner!  We had 2 great beers, the 'Homer' & the 'Underwood' sandwiches.  Beers were very good - from local breweries.  Both sandwiches - delish!  Homer is veggie w/broccolini, cauliflower & onions (yummy!),  Underwood is house pastrimi.  For sides we tried the sweet potato chip (dusted w/brown sugar) & their version of mac 'n cheese (very tasty).  The place was about 3/4 full on a Tues @ lunch. . . . we will be back - need to try some of others items on the menu!  Ryan mention not to miss trying the 'pigs in a blanket' - will do, next time, Ryan!

data.title: The Nightlife in . . . Alpharetta??
data.text:
Gastro Pub, Butcher & Brew has been a breath of fresh air in the close-by-9 Alpharetta downtown scene!  We've been by there at, on a week night no less, at TEN, and it was hopping!  There's no magic formula to this, really, it's just a very well thought out bar designed to open onto the sidewalk.  Start with the success of South Main Kitchen (good job, Scott and Shan, et al), then bake it down to a bar, a kitchen, and an open concept allowing the good vibe to spill into the Alpharetta evening.

The food is superb, the bar crew is just as good, and there are TVs aplenty for the sports-addict.  Have some fresh popcorn while waiting on your dinner, or just because.  This is actually terrific 'just because' place to hang out with friends, enjoy great pub fare, a good IPA, and dig being in yes, Alpharetta!

data.title: I expected better from other reviews. Not impressed.
data.text: From reading the reviews, I expected better. I love goat cheese and pimento cheese, but the goat cheese pimento fritter were just strange. It has a sweetness that made me think maybe they had gone bad or someone put sugar in them by mistake, while still having a kick at the end. I wouldn't have it again. I had the tomato bisque with blue cheese. Tasted like a carrot soup. Jim had the Underwood. For the price, thus Reuben was small. Smaller than hand size. The side of slaw seemed to have mustard in it. The best part of the meal was the sweet potato chips. I didn't even like the pickle. Plus, I didn't like the unwrapped silverware on the table. Will not repeat visit.

data.title: Fabulous
data.text:
I review based on expectations vs. experience. 

I had high expectations and they were met. I went for a lunch date with my wife and had the "Adrian" sandwich. She had the Paleo bowl. Both were outstanding. The service was excellent as well. 

It was a little overpriced in my opinion, but most things are in this area. 

It's a treat. Go.

data.title: Great Burger and Fried Cauliflower
data.text: Cool new spot with Great service at the bar. Good choice of brews. Heard rave reviews about the burger and it didn't disappoint. Food and Service worth the trip!

data.title: Disappointing food - too greasy
data.text:
I love their sister restaurant (located next door) but disappointed with this restaurant.  

1) The popcorn placed on the table was not fresh
2) The restaurant is called Butcher & Brew but I didn't feel like the name of the restaurant matched the menu
3) The burger was dry and looked awkward (if you order this, you will understand).
4) The burger is not cooked to your preference. It comes out WELL and they put the cheese on too early while on the grill, so the cheese dripped off.  
5) The fries were too greasy. 
6) The shrimp sandwich was good, fresh shrimp but again too greasy. 
7) Is this a restaurant or bar???   

Again, disappointed with the whole meal.  I love their sister restaurant next door but this place was not worth it.  

I hope they can get it together.   They seems to lose their way with this poorly executed concept.

data.title: another great restaurant on main st.!
data.text: the menu is small but still has a great variety. our server Amy was wonderful as was her trainee. great cocktails too! their twist on the moscow mule is amazing

data.title: Too expensive
data.text: I had high hopes for this place, but after one visit, I can't see me coming back.   Just way too expensive.   Food was just okay, but definitely  not worth the price.  Good beer selection,  but that's a bit on the high side as well.  Service was just okay.  Not spectacular.   $30 for lunch is just too much
